ratings.comment: Very hard to understand this professor given his very thick accent. Class content is posted ahead of time, and attendance is pointless unless you read the slides. Midterms and final is nothing like the practice exams or review sessions. Don't take this section.

Prof. Nguyen is very kind and accessible outside of class, but his teaching is very unorganized. He doesn't use his tablet to solve problems in lecture, he just writes them out before hand for students to look at. I did not attend lecture after the first week, as going to class was often counterproductive.

Super nice and really helpful. Always willing to go over stuff in office hours and responds to emails fast. Midterm was easy, mostly basic concepts. Final was tougher and covered way more. But he grades generously and adjusted the cutoffs, so that helped a lot. As long as you keep up, you'll be fine

Great prof! Really helped me understand the behind the formula instead of just memorizing stuff. His examples in class were super helpful, and the exams were pretty fair, very similar to past tests and what we did in lecture.

He is a terrible professor. He does not care about his students' success at all and has horribly organized lectures. His tests were nothing like what was taught in class. His TAs hated him and his teaching method. Overall, he made what was supposed to be a fairly easy class unnecessarily hard.

Nguyen is a legit lifesaver. You can tell he wants you to succeed. His lectures and reviews are GOLD - exams are straight from them, no hidden tricks. Not the most hype class, but an easy A if you show up.

If you're looking to boost your GPA, take Nguyen. The exams are straight from his lectures—just with new numbers.Two review sessions before each test. I didn't touch the textbook—heck, I forgot I even had one. Spent more time deciding what to eat for lunch than prepping for this class, and still walked away with an A like it was nothing.
All of the TAs disliked him and did not agree with his teaching or the content he put on the test. Test heavy and failed to get through the review guides during his classes.

Genuinely the worst professor I have ever had. A student had a question during the exam and he told them to "hold on" then went on his phone and texted for a minute, then finally turned back around and answered the student. Has terrible lecture method, despite the accent that no one can understand, he  has no sense of note-taking.

This class was a breeze! slides are up way ahead of time and lectures just follow them closely. The tests mirrored the examples he covered. Miss a class? He'll tell you exactly what to review. Easiest A+ I ever get in a math class.

Not a good professor, very slow paced, and only reads off the slides. After going to class the first few weeks and only him reading off the slides, I decided that I would learn better by teaching myself the topics. I haven't gone to class since. My TA did not help whatsoever, only told us to work on the discussion worksheet and hope for the best.

Class itself isn't hard. Trinh is an awful professor.I went to class the first week and thats it. He goes SO slow and is super hard to understand. I did better when I stopped going. We didn't even get thru half of the content for the final and the practice tests aren't helpful and keys are wrong. Oh and discussion TAs are NOT HELPFUL. AT ALL.
Great prof and super helpful during office hours. Would totally take him again
Professor Nguyen is such a chill and helpful guy and he's super approachable. Made studying way less stressful. 10/10 would take again.

Prof. Nguyen is super nice and always willing to help. He's available on Zoom if you have questions and really takes time to explain things clearly. His lectures are organized and he really helped me understand the material. Definitely recommend!

Worst professor I've ever had. Lectures suck and taught myself all the content. When I ask exam questions, he gets frustrated and refuses to answer. My uncle died 2 days before the final, and I asked if I could take the exam a few hours earlier to make it home for the funeral. He said no and refused to negotiate. Also, exams are 87% of your grade.

The instructor explained things really well. Sometimes it was super basic stuff, but I appreciated that he took the time to cover it. It wasn't the most engaging class though—I think it could've used more interaction. The structure was a bit off at times, but he did a good job connecting the topics and reviewing how everything fit together

really like the pace of the class, didn't rush and sometimes took extra time to go deeper into important stuff instead of just flying through the slides. Super nice and helpful during office hours too, and he'd even stay late sometimes to make sure you really got it. would totally take him again.

The exams are worth like 87% of your grade, so yeah, but he always spends a whole lecture reviewing before each one, which helps a lot. He gives practice questions with solutions. His class is boring if you already read the slides ahead of time since he mostly goes through them again. if you ask questions, he's super helpful.

If I didn't take this class in high school id have done bad because he explains incredibly poorly and is so unorganized. I self taught myself the entire class and rarely went to lecture because it was counterintuitive. manages to make math 211 hard. the answer keys had many mistakes and were often wrong and we didn't even finish all the material.

I went to maybe 10% of the lectures and I did better in the class once I stopped going. He is so hard to understand in class it's pointless to go. The lectures just consist of him talking through problems that he's already solved. At least the exams are super easy but they are usually significantly harder than the practice exams.

Avoid this prof. I'm sure he is a nice man, but GOD, he cannot teach. Somehow made calc even harder than it already is. Lectures are completely useless as he jumps around and explains random s*** for 30 minutes, then tests you on something else. Not the hardest class I've taken, but a thoroughly unenjoyable class and experience. AVOID.

I haven't been to class in MONTHS. He reads off of the slides and is so hard to understand. Somehow he confused me more than AP Calc ever did. Honestly pretty easy if you have a prior understanding of the class, but the lectures are useless. He is easy to contact outside of class tho. Quizzes in discussions some weeks, but only make up 2% of grade

Nguyen explains hard concepts in a way that actually makes sense. He's super organized, and his lectures are clear and helpful. He also replies to emails really fast, usually within minutes, which makes a big difference when you need help. Definitely one of the best professors I've had!

I took calc in highschool and he manages to make me confused on the topics. He goes through content at snails pace and reads off slides. The class is heavily weighed on 3 exams (87 percent) None of the midterms were like the practice exams or previous exams from past years. I genuinely think he write the exams the day of the test. AVOID!

Worst professor I've ever had at UW-Madison. His poor lecture delivery and handwriting made the lecture basically impossible to understand. Unless you have prior experience with calculus or no other option, avoid this professor at all costs. I genuinely don't understand how he was allowed to teach any class at such a prestigious university.
Professor Nguyen's lectures were clear and straightforward, but I found that working through the homework problems was the most helpful, especially since the exams closely reflected them.

Dr. Nguyen is one of the most difficult professors to understand in terms of course content. I have been teaching myself the course material from the textbook and it's more straightforward than his lectures. Beats around the bush, doesn't get to the point. He is not easily accessible. 
Discussions are a waste of time and aren't helpful.
Accent was very strong and hard to understand

Nguyen gives such little effort, his handwriting is horrible, and he spoken communication is not great. The class moved so slowly through basic background knowledge and sped through new material. We'd often spend the entire lecture period "reviewing" from the class prior, which just isn't helpful. Avoid if you can

Extremely annoying professor. Lectures are almost entirely just examples from the textbook, but much slower, harder to follow, less intuitive, and delivered in broken english. Good luck getting the homework graded before exams, both of which barely relate to whatever exercises he actually manages to work through in lecture.

My critizism is not because it was a hard class, it was because Nguyen showed the least effort I have ever seen in the classroom. Both vocal and written communication is unclear. He expects more memorization than understanding of math. Refuses to grade off of correctness. I have had 13 math professors at UW, most were great. He was the worst.
Nguyen's teaching was relatively straightforward, but I learned best by doing the homework problems since the exams were heavily based on those. We even got a full page of notes to use for each exam.

Trinh made math 321 way easier than Fabien's lecture. This is basically a big calc3 review session. Moves at a slow pace but explains things fairly. He is happy to explain anything if you ask, but few asked any questions in his lecture. A fair professor for a class known of its difficulty.

Moves at a slow pace. My one big issue with him is his rigidity in homework due dates. I had to miss class due to COVID and family issues for a total of almost 3 weeks. He refused to grant me any leeway or ability to make up missed HW. HW is due at a set time, no exceptions, no excuses. Never had a professor so rigid and uncompromising with HW ever

Dr. Nguyen was unreachable by email and made no use of Piazza or another platform for questions.  Furthermore, the pace of the class was excruciatingly slow. On multiple occasions we spent over an entire lecture on a single theorem. By the second-to-last week of class we hadn't even gotten to continuity. Waste of time.

If your idea of good prof is someone who rushes through various topics, don't take the course with him. On the other hand, if you want to understand the basics of real analysis, this course is great. He taught the material well and in-depth, rather than checking off a list of topics to be taught. I can see why this may not be everyone's cup of tea.

As an econ major first time taking proof-based math, I highly recommend Trinh to those with the same background. I really like the pace; he did not go through the material very quickly, and for some classes, he chose to dig into depth instead of covering more. Problem sets due weekly, but the best way to learn math is to do the problems.

The class pacing was awful: one week total on Chapters 4 and 7 and we never covered Chapters 5 and 6, so we came out of an analysis class without learning differentiation. Homework is due before their relevant lectures so going to lectures was often just pointless. Completely inaccessible by email so good luck contacting him. Just avoid if possible

Underprepares you for further study in undergraduate analysis because the course is incredibly slow in pace. Disorganized mess of a class. Unclear grading criteria. Unhelpful and terrible communicator. Analysis is a wonderful subject in math, but he does a terrible exposee of it. Take with someone else.
Just take with someone else. He is too slow and does not teach well and do not help at all.

Trinh was slow and made the course essentially self taught. There is minimal value to even going to lectures as I found youtube videos covering the same textbook that were infinitely more helpful in understanding the material. He does not help students through any form of QnA, and doesn't have piazza or respond to emails

This professor is very good, but the course is pretty tough. I think he teaches it as well as anyone can. I like the pace of the class. Professor also seems to have an answer for every question. If you want to take the course,  he is a good choice.

This class is a delight, with a wonderful professor whose knowledge and passion for the subject shines through in every lecture. The harsh reviews are misleading and tell you more about the students than the professor. If you don't like real analysis, why are you majoring in math? Did you take the course because you wanted to or because you had to?

Other reviews are far too harsh. He is by no means amazing, and he can be difficult to understand, but he more than makes up for this with being a very light grader, and assigning fairly easy homework. MATH 521 is a challenging class no matter what, but he holds the class's hand through the whole thing and makes it very manageable. Would recommend.

Worst professor I've ever had in my academic career. His English is terrible and he's *extremely* difficult to understand, which is bad for as difficult a class as real analysis, since he doesn't explain concepts well at all. Very harsh grader on exams--prepare to get almost no partial credit. I got an A but it took all I had. PLEASE AVOID.

First, this is not a review of Nguyen as a person but just as a prof. He is really bad at teaching and do not explain concept well. His English is hard to understand and no practice exams. In addition, exams are graded really hard in small details and weighted reall high. And the exam styles are not consistent. Lots of HW. Avoid at all cost.
